page.title: 17SHREWTON AND THE RIVER TILL
page.content: We walked along a path by the River Till. There were lots of trees by the water: Willow, Elm, Poplar, Snowberry, Hawthorn, Beech and Fir trees. The stinging nettles had grown a lot and we had a job avoiding them. The river varies between three and four metres wide and the banks were low in parts because they had been flooded. When we were looking at the river we saw some Mallard ducks and some Moorhens with their red bills and white patches on their tails. In a nearby field we saw some sheep, a horse, goats, two geese, a cat and a dog. Recently a sponsored group of village people have been clearing a lot of weed and rubbish from the river bed, prior to it filling up with water again.
